trial_identification.studytitle: Transitory hypertonia in preterm infants during their first year of file: Clinical study and prognostic value
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Observation and analysis of the evolution of transitory hypertonia in preterm infants during their first year of life

interventions.interventions: Analyisis of transitory hypertonia evolution during preterm infant's first year of life (evaluation: at least once a trimester)
interventions.comparator: There's no control group, at the end the participants were divided according the outcome (presence or not of the hypertonia).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Evolution of transitory hypertonia, which were assessed by the observation of muscle resistance to stretching during passive movement. Using a goniometer the joint angles were also measured.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The evaluation were done at least once a trimester during preterm infant's first year of life.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Relation between transitory hypertonia and maternal factors and intercurrences. This outcome were assessed by the statistical comparison of both group factors
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At trial end the participants were divided into two groups according the presence or not of transitory hypertonia. The factor were taken from mothers/infants medical records.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Statistical analysis of transitory hypertonia incidence.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The evaluation were done at least once a trimester during preterm infant's first year of life.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: motordevelopment of preterm infants were observed according Gesell & Amatruda scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: The evaluation were done at least once a trimester during preterm infant's first year of life.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: preterm infants with gestational ages equal or under 34 weeks and with normal cranial ultrasound

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Faculdade de Ciencias Medicas da Santa Casa de Sao Paulo
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: rua Cesario Motta Junior, 112 - Sao Paulo/SP - 01221-900

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: rua Profa Wanda Perseguin, 48 - Sao Paulo/SP - 04709-020

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Preterm infants used to present transitory hipertonia during their first year of life. This trial aims to study its incidence and its correlation to pre-, peri-, and post-natal factors. Study the influence in the motor evolution and check if there is a clinical standard defined that might be used for prognostic, helping to an earlier treatment, when necessary.
